Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a new 6-storey multiple dwelling building consisting of 100 rental units with an amenity space on each level from the second storey to fourth storey and a common roof deck on fifth storey over one level of parking on the first storey containing bike rooms, storage rooms, service rooms, and garbage/recycling room, having vehicular access from Durward Avenue. 

This is a CP Process Permit and the applicant is Jack Hui, P. Eng., CP. 
NOTE by CP: Due to the natural grade of the site, the parkade will not be fully underground and will not be considered a basement.

Storage garage on the first storey is a separate building as per AL-2023-00142. 

***REVIEWED UNDER VBBL 2019 WITH AMENDMENTS EFFECTIVE ON MAR 07, 2023***

STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1: Excavation & Shoring. (Dec 15/23, A.Min)
Stage 2: Foundation to Grade (IN PROCESS)

Low Density Housing - New Building - To construct a 2 storey one-family dwelling with a secondary suite located in the Basement ($600,000) with a detached accessory building (garage)  and an open parking pad, at the rear providing 2 parking spaces, having vehicular access from the lane.

This Building Permit will remain in a suspended status until the associated (green) Demolition Permit BP-2023-02245 is completed.
 
1.\tCovenant registered at the Land Title Office under CB739785
2.\tNo Strata Titling permitted
3.\tExternal mechanical unit proposed
4.\tSchedule B: (H. Ilbeigi Timouri) P.Eng (778.558.9629) Structural
5.\tSchedule B: (Thanh Van Le) P.Eng (604.421.3288) Geotechnical
6.\tHPO: Residential Builder- VGC Vancouver General Contractors Inc.
7.      As shown by an asterisk (*) on the building permit floor plans and/or elevations, exit protection is required to be provided in accordance with Articles 9.9.4.4., 9.9.4.6., and/or 9.37.2.8. of the 2019 VBBL

Note: This is a 2 storey building pursuant to the Zoning and Development By-Law

Address Information:

#1- 4949 Culloden St - Single Detached House (1st & 2nd floors)
#2- 4949 Culloden St - Secondary Suite (basement)

Address and suite numbers assigned as per approved plans for Fire and Emergency response. The address number is to be posted on the building to be visible from the street and the suite numbers are to be posted at the suite entries in accordance with the Building By-law prior to final inspection.

**THIS PERMIT HAS BEEN ISSUED UNDER THE REQUIREMENTS OF VBBL #12511 (2019) **


***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***

Construction of a new single detached dwelling and coach house. The coach house is approximately 60 m2 (645 ft2) and is designed to comply with the intent of the design guidelines for coach houses in the Edgemere neighbourhood contained in the City's Official Community Plan (OCP), and complies with the zoning requirements. The proposed coach house has addressed urban design issues and staff comments, and complies with the conditions of adjacency, urban design and site planning, architectural form and character, and landscape design and open space design. The proposed coach house is set back 2.0 m from the south side lot line to minimize shadowing of adjacent properties, and has no windows proposed on the north or south side elevations to address concerns of overlook into the neighbouring properties. The primary pedestrian entry to the coach house is from the rear lane, and private outdoor space for the exclusive benefit of the coach house is proposed in the form of a landscaped yard off the west side of the coach house. The proposed exterior building materials and colours of the coach house are consistent with the building styles in the neighbourhood. The site plan provides on-site parking in compliance with the Zoning Bylaw, and a single shared garbage and recycling enclosure is proposed for the site. There are no on-site trees in the area of the proposed coach house and garage, and future assessment of on-site tree retention and removal will be reviewed at the time of the building permit application for the single-family dwelling.
